jpmorgan-chase.name: Jamie Dimon
jpmorgan-chase.bio: Has served as Chairman and CEO of JPMorgan Chase since 2005. One of the most prominent figures in global banking, he led the firm through the 2008 financial crisis.

jpmorgan-chase.name: Daniel Pinto
jpmorgan-chase.bio: President and Chief Operating Officer of JPMorgan Chase. Previously led the Corporate & Investment Bank division.

jpmorgan-chase.name: Mary Callahan Erdoes
jpmorgan-chase.bio: Head of JPMorgan's Asset & Wealth Management division overseeing trillions in client assets. Consistently ranked among the most powerful women in finance.

jpmorgan-chase.name: Marianne Lake
jpmorgan-chase.bio: Co-CEO of Consumer & Community Banking at JPMorgan Chase. Previously served as the firm's Chief Financial Officer.

blackrock.name: Larry Fink
blackrock.bio: Co-founded BlackRock in 1988 and built it into the world's largest asset manager with over $10 trillion in assets under management.

blackrock.name: Robert Kapito
blackrock.bio: Co-founded BlackRock alongside Larry Fink and has served as President since the firm's inception.

blackrock.name: Barbara Novick
blackrock.bio: One of the eight co-founders of BlackRock and served as Vice Chairman overseeing government relations and public policy.

blackrock.name: Rob Goldstein
blackrock.bio: Serves as Chief Operating Officer and oversees BlackRock Solutions, the firm's technology and risk analytics platform.

pfizer.name: Albert Bourla
pfizer.bio: Chairman and CEO of Pfizer who led the company's rapid development and global rollout of the COVID-19 vaccine in partnership with BioNTech.

pfizer.name: Ian Read
pfizer.bio: Served as Pfizer's CEO from 2010 to 2018 and as Chairman until 2019, overseeing major acquisitions and restructuring.

pfizer.name: Sally Susman
pfizer.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Corporate Affairs Officer at Pfizer, responsible for global communications and government relations.

pfizer.name: Mikael Dolsten
pfizer.bio: Served as President of Worldwide Research, Development and Medical at Pfizer, leading the company's R&D pipeline for over a decade.

johnson-johnson.name: Joaquin Duato
johnson-johnson.bio: Became CEO of Johnson & Johnson in 2022 after over 30 years with the company. Oversaw the split of the consumer health division.

johnson-johnson.name: Alex Gorsky
johnson-johnson.bio: Led Johnson & Johnson as CEO from 2012 to 2022, guiding the company through significant growth and the development of its COVID-19 vaccine.

johnson-johnson.name: Paul Stoffels
johnson-johnson.role: Former Vice Chairman & Chief Scientific Officer
johnson-johnson.bio: Served as J&J's Chief Scientific Officer and Vice Chairman of the Executive Committee, driving pharmaceutical innovation including the Janssen COVID vaccine.

johnson-johnson.name: Jennifer Taubert
johnson-johnson.bio: Executive Vice President and Worldwide Chairman of Johnson & Johnson's pharmaceutical business, one of the largest pharma divisions globally.

bloomberg-philanthropies.name: Michael Bloomberg
bloomberg-philanthropies.bio: Billionaire businessman and former Mayor of New York City who has donated over $17 billion to philanthropic causes through Bloomberg Philanthropies.

bloomberg-philanthropies.name: Patricia Harris
bloomberg-philanthropies.bio: CEO of Bloomberg Philanthropies, overseeing all of the organization's charitable initiatives spanning public health, environment, education, and the arts.

bloomberg-philanthropies.name: James Anderson
bloomberg-philanthropies.bio: Leads Bloomberg Philanthropies' Government Innovation programs including What Works Cities and the American Cities Climate Challenge.

bloomberg-l-p.name: Michael Bloomberg
bloomberg-l-p.bio: Founded Bloomberg L.P. in 1981, creating the Bloomberg Terminal which revolutionized financial data services. Former three-term Mayor of New York City.

bloomberg-l-p.name: Peter Grauer
bloomberg-l-p.bio: Chairman of Bloomberg L.P., overseeing corporate governance of the global financial data and media company.

bloomberg-l-p.name: Tom Secunda
bloomberg-l-p.bio: Co-founded Bloomberg L.P. and served as Vice Chairman. Helped design and build the original Bloomberg Terminal system.

bloomberg-l-p.name: Matthew Winkler
bloomberg-l-p.role: Co-founder of Bloomberg News & Editor-in-Chief Emeritus
bloomberg-l-p.bio: Founded Bloomberg News in 1990 and served as Editor-in-Chief for 25 years, building it into one of the world's largest news organizations.

oracle-corporation.name: Larry Ellison
oracle-corporation.bio: Co-founded Oracle in 1977 and built it into one of the world's largest software companies. One of the wealthiest people in the world.

oracle-corporation.name: Safra Catz
oracle-corporation.bio: CEO of Oracle Corporation, previously serving as co-CEO and CFO. One of the highest-paid female executives in the technology industry.

oracle-corporation.name: Bob Miner
oracle-corporation.bio: Co-founded Oracle Corporation (originally Software Development Laboratories) in 1977 and led its early database development efforts until his death in 1994.

oracle-corporation.name: Ed Oates
oracle-corporation.bio: Co-founded Oracle alongside Larry Ellison and Bob Miner in 1977. Contributed to the early development of Oracle's relational database technology.

intel-corporation.name: Gordon Moore
intel-corporation.bio: Co-founded Intel in 1968 and formulated Moore's Law, predicting the doubling of transistors on integrated circuits approximately every two years.

intel-corporation.name: Robert Noyce
intel-corporation.bio: Co-founded Intel and co-invented the integrated circuit. Known as the 'Mayor of Silicon Valley' for his foundational contributions to the tech industry.

intel-corporation.name: Andy Grove
intel-corporation.bio: Third employee and later CEO of Intel who transformed it into the world's dominant semiconductor company. Time Magazine's Man of the Year in 1997.

intel-corporation.name: Pat Gelsinger
intel-corporation.bio: Served as Intel's CEO from 2021 to 2024, leading the company's IDM 2.0 strategy and major investments in semiconductor manufacturing.

nvidia-corporation.name: Jensen Huang
nvidia-corporation.bio: Co-founded Nvidia in 1993 and led its transformation from a graphics chip company into the dominant force in AI computing and data center GPUs.

nvidia-corporation.name: Chris Malachowsky
nvidia-corporation.bio: Co-founded Nvidia in 1993 alongside Jensen Huang and Curtis Priem. Instrumental in the development of the company's early GPU technology.

nvidia-corporation.name: Curtis Priem
nvidia-corporation.bio: Co-founded Nvidia and served as its first Chief Technical Officer. Designed Nvidia's first graphics chip before retiring in 2003.

nvidia-corporation.name: Colette Kress
nvidia-corporation.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Nvidia, overseeing the company's finances during its meteoric rise in the AI era.

dell-technologies.name: Michael Dell
dell-technologies.bio: Founded Dell Technologies in his University of Texas dorm room in 1984. Took the company private in 2013 and returned it to public markets in 2018.

dell-technologies.name: Jeff Clarke
dell-technologies.bio: Serves as Vice Chairman and Chief Operating Officer of Dell Technologies, overseeing product development and supply chain operations.

dell-technologies.name: Tom Sweet
dell-technologies.bio: Chief Financial Officer of Dell Technologies, managing the company's financial strategy and investor relations.

salesforce.name: Marc Benioff
salesforce.bio: Co-founded Salesforce in 1999 and pioneered the software-as-a-service business model. Known for stakeholder capitalism and philanthropic commitments.

salesforce.name: Parker Harris
salesforce.bio: Co-founded Salesforce and served as its Chief Technology Officer, building the cloud computing platform that defined enterprise SaaS.

salesforce.name: Bret Taylor
salesforce.bio: Served as Salesforce co-CEO alongside Marc Benioff. Previously co-created Google Maps and served as CTO of Facebook.

salesforce.name: Keith Block
salesforce.bio: Served as Salesforce co-CEO in 2018-2020 and previously as Vice Chairman and President, driving enterprise sales growth.

zoom-video-communications.name: Eric Yuan
zoom-video-communications.bio: Founded Zoom Video Communications in 2011 after leaving Cisco. Led the platform's explosive growth during the COVID-19 pandemic.

zoom-video-communications.name: Aparna Bawa
zoom-video-communications.bio: Served as Chief Operating Officer of Zoom, responsible for legal, compliance, security, and business operations.

zoom-video-communications.name: Kelly Steckelberg
zoom-video-communications.bio: Served as Chief Financial Officer of Zoom Video Communications, guiding the company's financial strategy through its IPO and rapid growth period.

crowdstrike.name: George Kurtz
crowdstrike.bio: Co-founded CrowdStrike in 2011 and built it into a leading cybersecurity company. Previously served as CTO of McAfee.

crowdstrike.name: Dmitri Alperovitch
crowdstrike.bio: Co-founded CrowdStrike and served as CTO. A renowned cybersecurity expert who led the investigation of the 2016 DNC breach.

crowdstrike.name: Shawn Henry
crowdstrike.role: Chief Security Officer & President of CrowdStrike Services
crowdstrike.bio: Leads CrowdStrike's services division. Former Executive Assistant Director of the FBI overseeing criminal and cyber investigations.

palo-alto-networks.name: Nikesh Arora
palo-alto-networks.bio: Chairman and CEO of Palo Alto Networks since 2018. Previously served as President of SoftBank and Chief Business Officer of Google.

palo-alto-networks.name: Nir Zuk
palo-alto-networks.bio: Founded Palo Alto Networks in 2005 and created the next-generation firewall concept. Previously a principal engineer at Check Point and founder of OneSecure.

palo-alto-networks.name: Mark McLaughlin
palo-alto-networks.bio: Served as Palo Alto Networks CEO from 2011 to 2018, growing the company into a cybersecurity industry leader before becoming Vice Chairman.

broadcom-inc.name: Hock Tan
broadcom-inc.bio: President and CEO of Broadcom who orchestrated the company's aggressive acquisition strategy including the $61 billion purchase of VMware.

broadcom-inc.name: Henry Samueli
broadcom-inc.bio: Co-founded Broadcom Corporation in 1991 with Henry Nicholas. A distinguished professor of electrical engineering at UCLA and owner of the Anaheim Ducks.

broadcom-inc.name: Henry Nicholas III
broadcom-inc.bio: Co-founded Broadcom Corporation in 1991 alongside Henry Samueli, serving as President and CEO through the company's formative years.

broadcom-inc.name: Charlie Kawwas
broadcom-inc.bio: President of Broadcom's Semiconductor Solutions Group, overseeing the company's core chip business across networking, storage, and wireless markets.

akamai-technologies.name: Tom Leighton
akamai-technologies.bio: Co-founded Akamai Technologies in 1998 and has served as CEO since 2013. An MIT professor of applied mathematics who helped invent content delivery network technology.

akamai-technologies.name: Danny Lewin
akamai-technologies.bio: Co-founded Akamai Technologies while a graduate student at MIT. Tragically killed aboard American Airlines Flight 11 on September 11, 2001.

akamai-technologies.name: Robert Blumofe
akamai-technologies.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Technology Officer of Akamai, leading the company's technology strategy and platform development.

slack-technologies.name: Stewart Butterfield
slack-technologies.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies and served as CEO until its $27.7 billion acquisition by Salesforce in 2021. Previously co-founded Flickr.

slack-technologies.name: Cal Henderson
slack-technologies.bio: Co-founded Slack and served as Chief Technology Officer, designing and building the messaging platform's core architecture.

slack-technologies.name: Eric Costello
slack-technologies.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies and contributed to the platform's development. Previously worked with Stewart Butterfield at Flickr.

slack-technologies.name: Serguei Mourachov
slack-technologies.bio: Co-founded Slack Technologies alongside Stewart Butterfield, Cal Henderson, and Eric Costello. Part of the original team at Tiny Speck.

uber-technologies.name: Travis Kalanick
uber-technologies.bio: Co-founded Uber in 2009 and served as CEO until 2017, growing it into one of the most valuable startups in history before a series of controversies led to his departure.

uber-technologies.name: Garrett Camp
uber-technologies.bio: Co-founded Uber alongside Travis Kalanick. A Canadian entrepreneur who previously co-founded StumbleUpon.

uber-technologies.name: Dara Khosrowshahi
uber-technologies.bio: Became CEO of Uber in 2017, leading the company through its IPO and shift toward profitability. Previously CEO of Expedia Group.

airbnb.name: Brian Chesky
airbnb.bio: Co-founded Airbnb in 2008 and serves as CEO. A former industrial designer who transformed the hospitality industry through the home-sharing platform.

airbnb.name: Joe Gebbia
airbnb.bio: Co-founded Airbnb alongside Brian Chesky and Nathan Blecharczyk. Led the company's design and product innovation as CPO before stepping back.

airbnb.name: Nathan Blecharczyk
airbnb.bio: Co-founded Airbnb and built the original platform. Serves as Chief Strategy Officer and Chairman of Airbnb China.

wework.name: Adam Neumann
wework.bio: Israeli-born entrepreneur who co-founded WeWork in 2010 and grew it into a $47 billion valued company before a spectacular fall from grace during its failed 2019 IPO.

wework.name: Miguel McKelvey
wework.bio: Co-founded WeWork with Adam Neumann and served as Chief Creative Officer, shaping the company's distinctive workspace design philosophy.

wework.name: Sandeep Mathrani
wework.bio: Served as WeWork CEO from 2020 to 2023, brought in to stabilize the company after Adam Neumann's departure. A veteran real estate executive.

netflix.name: Reed Hastings
netflix.bio: Co-founded Netflix in 1997 and led its transformation from a DVD-by-mail service to the world's leading streaming entertainment platform.

netflix.name: Marc Randolph
netflix.bio: Co-founded Netflix with Reed Hastings and served as its first CEO. Conceived the original DVD-by-mail business model.

netflix.name: Ted Sarandos
netflix.bio: Co-CEO of Netflix who oversees the company's global content strategy. Pioneered Netflix's move into original programming with shows like House of Cards.

netflix.name: Greg Peters
netflix.bio: Serves as Co-CEO of Netflix alongside Ted Sarandos. Previously served as COO and led the company's product and technology divisions.

starbucks.name: Howard Schultz
starbucks.bio: Joined Starbucks in 1982 and served as CEO across three stints, transforming a small Seattle coffee chain into a global brand with over 35,000 stores worldwide.

starbucks.name: Jerry Baldwin
starbucks.bio: Co-founded Starbucks in 1971 in Seattle's Pike Place Market alongside Zev Siegl and Gordon Bowker, originally as a roasted coffee bean retailer.

starbucks.name: Zev Siegl
starbucks.bio: Co-founded Starbucks in 1971 and served as the first manager of the original Pike Place store before departing in 1980.

starbucks.name: Kevin Johnson
starbucks.bio: Served as Starbucks CEO from 2017 to 2022, leading the company through the COVID-19 pandemic and expansion of its digital ordering capabilities.

costco-wholesale.name: Jim Sinegal
costco-wholesale.bio: Co-founded Costco in 1983 and served as CEO until 2012, building the membership warehouse model known for high employee wages and low markups.

costco-wholesale.name: Jeffrey Brotman
costco-wholesale.bio: Co-founded Costco Wholesale with Jim Sinegal in 1983 and served as Chairman of the Board until his death in 2017.

costco-wholesale.name: W. Craig Jelinek
costco-wholesale.bio: Succeeded Jim Sinegal as Costco's CEO in 2012, continuing the company's growth to become the third-largest retailer in the world.

costco-wholesale.name: Sol Price
costco-wholesale.bio: Founded Price Club in 1976, which later merged with Costco. Mentored Jim Sinegal and created the warehouse club retail concept that Costco perfected.

home-depot.name: Bernie Marcus
home-depot.bio: Co-founded The Home Depot in 1978 and served as its first CEO and Chairman. A major philanthropist who donated over $2 billion to various causes.

home-depot.name: Arthur Blank
home-depot.bio: Co-founded The Home Depot with Bernie Marcus and Ken Langone. Later purchased the Atlanta Falcons NFL team and co-founded the PGA Tour Superstore.

home-depot.name: Ken Langone
home-depot.bio: Provided early financing for The Home Depot and served on its board. An investment banker and major benefactor of NYU Langone Health.

home-depot.name: Frank Blake
home-depot.bio: Served as Chairman and CEO of The Home Depot from 2007 to 2014, guiding the company's recovery after the 2008 financial crisis.

nordstrom.name: Bruce Nordstrom
nordstrom.bio: Third-generation member of the Nordstrom family who served as Chairman and helped expand the department store chain nationally.

nordstrom.name: Erik Nordstrom
nordstrom.bio: Fourth-generation family member serving as CEO of Nordstrom. Has led the company's digital transformation and omnichannel retail strategy.

nordstrom.name: Pete Nordstrom
nordstrom.bio: Fourth-generation family member serving as President and Chief Brand Officer, overseeing Nordstrom's merchandising and brand strategy.

nordstrom.name: John W. Nordstrom
nordstrom.bio: Swedish immigrant who founded the original Nordstrom shoe store in Seattle in 1901 using gold rush earnings, building the foundation for the retail empire.

ralph-lauren-corporation.name: Ralph Lauren
ralph-lauren-corporation.bio: Founded Ralph Lauren Corporation in 1967, building a global fashion empire synonymous with American style. Born Ralph Lifshitz in the Bronx, New York.

ralph-lauren-corporation.name: Patrice Louvet
ralph-lauren-corporation.bio: President and CEO of Ralph Lauren Corporation since 2017, previously a senior executive at Procter & Gamble for over 25 years.

ralph-lauren-corporation.name: David Lauren
ralph-lauren-corporation.role: Vice Chairman & Chief Branding and Innovation Officer
ralph-lauren-corporation.bio: Vice Chairman of Ralph Lauren Corporation and son of founder Ralph Lauren. Oversees the company's branding, marketing, and digital innovation strategy.

calvin-klein.name: Calvin Klein
calvin-klein.bio: Founded his eponymous fashion house in 1968, becoming renowned for minimalist design and provocative advertising. Sold the brand to PVH Corp in 2003.

calvin-klein.name: Barry Schwartz
calvin-klein.bio: Childhood friend of Calvin Klein who co-founded the company and served as Chairman and CEO, managing the business side of the brand for decades.

calvin-klein.name: Emanuel 'Manny' Chirico
calvin-klein.bio: Served as CEO of PVH Corp (parent company of Calvin Klein) from 2006 to 2021, overseeing the acquisition and global expansion of the Calvin Klein brand.

donna-karan-dkny.name: Donna Karan
donna-karan-dkny.bio: Founded Donna Karan International in 1984 and launched the DKNY line in 1989. Known for creating the 'Seven Easy Pieces' wardrobe concept for modern women.

donna-karan-dkny.name: Stephan Weiss
donna-karan-dkny.bio: Co-founded Donna Karan International with his wife Donna Karan and served as CEO and sculptor. Passed away in 2001.

donna-karan-dkny.name: Caroline Brown
donna-karan-dkny.role: Former CEO of Donna Karan International
donna-karan-dkny.bio: Served as CEO of Donna Karan International under LVMH ownership, managing the brand's global operations and retail strategy.

marc-jacobs.name: Marc Jacobs
marc-jacobs.bio: Founded his namesake label and served as creative director of Louis Vuitton from 1997 to 2014. One of the most influential American fashion designers of his generation.

marc-jacobs.name: Robert Duffy
marc-jacobs.bio: Business partner and co-founder of Marc Jacobs International who managed the business operations of the brand for over two decades.

marc-jacobs.name: Sebastian Suhl
marc-jacobs.bio: Served as CEO of Marc Jacobs International, overseeing the brand's commercial operations and global expansion under LVMH ownership.

levi-strauss-co.name: Levi Strauss
levi-strauss-co.bio: German-Jewish immigrant who founded Levi Strauss & Co. in 1853 in San Francisco. Patented riveted denim jeans with Jacob Davis, creating an American icon.

levi-strauss-co.name: Chip Bergh
levi-strauss-co.bio: Served as President and CEO of Levi Strauss from 2011 to 2024, leading the company through its successful return to the public markets in 2019.

levi-strauss-co.name: Robert D. Haas
levi-strauss-co.bio: Great-great-grandnephew of founder Levi Strauss, served as CEO from 1984 to 1999 and Chairman until 2008. Championed progressive labor policies.

levi-strauss-co.name: Peter Haas Sr.
levi-strauss-co.bio: Served as Chairman of Levi Strauss & Co. and was a prominent San Francisco philanthropist. A descendant of the Strauss and Stern families.

michael-kors-capri-holdings.name: Michael Kors
michael-kors-capri-holdings.bio: Founded his namesake fashion line in 1981, building it into a global luxury lifestyle brand. Born Karl Anderson Jr. and raised by his mother and stepfather.

michael-kors-capri-holdings.name: John Idol
michael-kors-capri-holdings.bio: Served as Chairman and CEO of Capri Holdings (formerly Michael Kors Holdings), overseeing the acquisitions of Versace and Jimmy Choo.

michael-kors-capri-holdings.name: Joshua Schulman
michael-kors-capri-holdings.bio: Served as CEO of the Michael Kors brand, responsible for the brand's global strategy, merchandising, and retail operations.

revlon.name: Charles Revson
revlon.bio: Co-founded Revlon in 1932 and built it into one of the world's leading cosmetics companies. A pioneering figure in beauty marketing and brand building.

revlon.name: Joseph Revson
revlon.bio: Co-founded Revlon alongside his brother Charles Revson and chemist Charles Lachman in 1932, contributing to the early growth of the cosmetics brand.

revlon.name: Ronald Perelman
revlon.bio: Acquired Revlon through a hostile takeover in 1985 via MacAndrews & Forbes and controlled the company for decades through its eventual bankruptcy in 2022.

revlon.name: Debra Perelman
revlon.bio: Daughter of Ronald Perelman who served as CEO of Revlon, leading the company through its Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing in 2022.

hasbro.name: Henry Hassenfeld
hasbro.bio: Founded Hassenfeld Brothers (later Hasbro) in 1923 in Providence, Rhode Island, originally selling textile remnants before pivoting to toys.

hasbro.name: Alan Hassenfeld
hasbro.bio: Third-generation family leader who served as CEO of Hasbro from 1989 to 2003, overseeing major acquisitions including Milton Bradley and Parker Brothers.

hasbro.name: Brian Goldner
hasbro.bio: Led Hasbro as CEO from 2008 until his passing in 2021, transforming the company into a global play and entertainment leader through franchise-driven storytelling.

hasbro.name: Chris Cocks
hasbro.bio: Became CEO of Hasbro in 2022 after leading Wizards of the Coast (Dungeons & Dragons, Magic: The Gathering). Focused on digital gaming and entertainment.

mattel.name: Ruth Handler
mattel.bio: Co-founded Mattel in 1945 and created the Barbie doll in 1959, revolutionizing the toy industry. Named Barbie after her daughter Barbara.

mattel.name: Elliot Handler
mattel.bio: Co-founded Mattel with his wife Ruth Handler and Harold Matson. An inventor and craftsman who created many of Mattel's early toy designs.

mattel.name: Harold 'Matt' Matson
mattel.bio: Co-founded Mattel in 1945 with Ruth and Elliot Handler. The company name is a combination of 'Matt' (Matson) and 'El' (Elliot).

mattel.name: Ynon Kreiz
mattel.bio: Israeli-born media executive who became CEO of Mattel in 2018, leading the company's turnaround and the blockbuster Barbie film franchise.

sears-roebuck-historic.name: Richard Warren Sears
sears-roebuck-historic.bio: Co-founded Sears, Roebuck and Company in 1893 after starting a watch sales business. Pioneered the mail-order catalog that transformed American retail.

sears-roebuck-historic.name: Alvah Curtis Roebuck
sears-roebuck-historic.bio: Co-founded Sears, Roebuck and Company with Richard Sears. A watchmaker who helped establish the company's early reputation for quality merchandise.

sears-roebuck-historic.name: Julius Rosenwald
sears-roebuck-historic.bio: Joined Sears in 1895 and became President in 1908, transforming it into America's largest retailer. A renowned philanthropist who built over 5,000 schools for African Americans.

sears-roebuck-historic.name: Edward Lampert
sears-roebuck-historic.bio: Hedge fund manager who merged Kmart and Sears in 2005 and served as CEO. His tenure was marked by declining sales, store closures, and Sears' eventual bankruptcy in 2018.

toys-r-us-historic.name: Charles Lazarus
toys-r-us-historic.bio: Founded Toys 'R' Us in 1948 as a baby furniture store in Washington, D.C., eventually building it into the world's largest toy retailer before its 2017 bankruptcy.

toys-r-us-historic.name: Gerald Storch
toys-r-us-historic.bio: Served as CEO of Toys 'R' Us from 2006 to 2013, working to revitalize the retailer during a period of intense competition from online sellers.

toys-r-us-historic.name: Dave Brandon
toys-r-us-historic.bio: Served as CEO of Toys 'R' Us from 2015 through its bankruptcy filing in 2017. Previously served as CEO of Domino's Pizza and University of Michigan Athletic Director.

bloomingdale-s.name: Joseph Bloomingdale
bloomingdale-s.bio: Co-founded Bloomingdale's in 1861 on the Lower East Side of Manhattan with his brother Lyman, originally as a small dry goods store.

bloomingdale-s.name: Lyman Bloomingdale
bloomingdale-s.bio: Co-founded Bloomingdale's with his brother Joseph in 1861 and helped grow it into one of New York's premier department stores.

bloomingdale-s.name: Marvin Traub
bloomingdale-s.bio: Legendary CEO of Bloomingdale's from 1978 to 1991 who transformed it into a cultural institution known for theatrical retail experiences and international designer partnerships.

bloomingdale-s.name: Tony Spring
bloomingdale-s.bio: Served as CEO of Bloomingdale's before becoming CEO of Macy's Inc. Led the department store's modernization and e-commerce expansion.

staples.name: Thomas Stemberg
staples.bio: Co-founded Staples in 1986, pioneering the office supply superstore concept. Bain Capital's investment in Staples was one of Mitt Romney's notable success stories.

staples.name: Leo Kahn
staples.bio: Co-founded Staples alongside Tom Stemberg in 1986. A serial entrepreneur who previously founded Purity Supreme supermarkets.

staples.name: Shira Goodman
staples.bio: Served as CEO of Staples from 2016 to 2018, the first woman to lead the company. Previously held senior roles in marketing and strategy at the retailer.

kind-snacks.name: Daniel Lubetzky
kind-snacks.bio: Mexican-born son of a Holocaust survivor who founded KIND Snacks in 2004. Also founded the OneVoice Movement promoting Israeli-Palestinian cooperation.

kind-snacks.name: John Leahy
kind-snacks.bio: Served as President and CFO of KIND Snacks, helping scale the company from a small startup to a major snack brand before its acquisition by Mars.

kind-snacks.name: Russell Stokes
kind-snacks.bio: Became CEO of KIND Snacks after Mars Inc. acquired the company, overseeing its continued growth and product expansion.

sabra-hummus.name: Ofra Strauss
sabra-hummus.bio: Chairwoman of Strauss Group, which co-owns Sabra Dipping Company. A prominent Israeli businesswoman leading one of Israel's largest food companies.

sabra-hummus.name: Ronen Zohar
sabra-hummus.bio: Former CEO of Strauss Group, the Israeli food conglomerate that partnered with PepsiCo's Frito-Lay to create the Sabra Dipping joint venture.

sabra-hummus.name: Shali Shalit Shelach
sabra-hummus.bio: Served as CEO of Sabra Dipping Company, the joint venture between Strauss Group and PepsiCo that dominates the U.S. hummus market.

nathan-s-famous.name: Nathan Handwerker
nathan-s-famous.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant who founded Nathan's Famous hot dog stand on Coney Island in 1916, starting with a nickel hot dog recipe from his former employer, Feltman's.

nathan-s-famous.name: Wayne Norbitz
nathan-s-famous.bio: Served as President and COO of Nathan's Famous for many years, managing the company's expansion from a Coney Island institution to a national franchise brand.

nathan-s-famous.name: Eric Gatoff
nathan-s-famous.bio: Served as CEO of Nathan's Famous Inc., overseeing the company's restaurant operations, branded products, and the iconic Nathan's Hot Dog Eating Contest.

h-agen-dazs.name: Reuben Mattus
h-agen-dazs.bio: Polish-Jewish immigrant who co-founded Häagen-Dazs in 1961 in the Bronx, New York. Invented the faux-Scandinavian name to convey an image of old-world craftsmanship.

h-agen-dazs.name: Rose Mattus
h-agen-dazs.bio: Co-founded Häagen-Dazs alongside her husband Reuben Mattus and was instrumental in building the premium ice cream brand before it was sold to Pillsbury in 1983.

h-agen-dazs.name: Doris Mattus Hurley
h-agen-dazs.bio: Daughter of founders Reuben and Rose Mattus who was involved in the family business during Häagen-Dazs's formative years.

manischewitz.name: Dov Behr Manischewitz
manischewitz.bio: Rabbi who founded the Manischewitz company in 1888 in Cincinnati, Ohio, mechanizing the production of matzo to make it widely accessible to Jewish communities.

manischewitz.name: Alain Bankier
manischewitz.bio: Served as CEO of the Manischewitz Company during a period of modernization and brand expansion beyond traditional Passover products.

manischewitz.name: David Sugarman
manischewitz.bio: Served as President and CEO of R.A.B. Food Group/Manischewitz, overseeing the kosher food company's product line and market positioning.

stonyfield-farm.name: Gary Hirshberg
stonyfield-farm.bio: Co-founded Stonyfield Farm in 1983 and served as CEO for nearly three decades, building it into the world's leading organic yogurt brand and a pioneer in sustainable business.

stonyfield-farm.name: Samuel Kaymen
stonyfield-farm.bio: Co-founded Stonyfield Farm with Gary Hirshberg at the Rural Education Center in Wilton, New Hampshire. An organic farming pioneer and educator.

stonyfield-farm.name: Esteve Torrens
stonyfield-farm.bio: Served as CEO of Stonyfield Farm after Gary Hirshberg, overseeing the brand under Lactalis ownership while maintaining its organic and mission-driven identity.

spacex.name: Elon Musk
spacex.bio: Founded SpaceX in 2002 with the goal of reducing space transportation costs and enabling Mars colonization. Also leads Tesla, and owns X (formerly Twitter).

spacex.name: Gwynne Shotwell
spacex.bio: President and Chief Operating Officer of SpaceX since 2008, managing the company's day-to-day operations, customer relationships, and launch manifest.

spacex.name: Tom Mueller
spacex.bio: Founding employee and former Vice President of Propulsion at SpaceX. Designed the Merlin and Raptor rocket engines that power the Falcon and Starship vehicles.

nextera-energy.name: James Robo
nextera-energy.bio: Served as Chairman, President and CEO of NextEra Energy from 2012 to 2022, growing it into the world's largest generator of renewable energy from wind and sun.

nextera-energy.name: John Ketchum
nextera-energy.bio: Became CEO of NextEra Energy in 2022, continuing the company's leadership in renewable energy development and clean energy infrastructure.

nextera-energy.name: Rebecca Kujawa
nextera-energy.role: President & CEO of NextEra Energy Resources
nextera-energy.bio: President and CEO of NextEra Energy Resources, the world's largest generator of renewable energy from wind and solar, and a leader in battery storage.

cheniere-energy.name: Charif Souki
cheniere-energy.bio: Lebanese-born co-founder of Cheniere Energy who led the development of the first large-scale LNG export facility in the contiguous United States at Sabine Pass.

cheniere-energy.name: Jack Fusco
cheniere-energy.bio: Serves as President and CEO of Cheniere Energy, overseeing operations of the largest natural gas liquefaction and LNG export company in the United States.

cheniere-energy.name: Anatol Feygin
cheniere-energy.bio: Executive Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer of Cheniere Energy, managing the company's global LNG marketing and commercial strategy.

abbvie.name: Richard Gonzalez
abbvie.bio: Served as founding Chairman and CEO of AbbVie when it was spun off from Abbott Laboratories in 2013. Led the company's growth driven by blockbuster drug Humira.

abbvie.name: Robert Michael
abbvie.bio: Became CEO of AbbVie in 2024, overseeing the company's transition beyond Humira and growth of its immunology, oncology, and neuroscience pipeline.

abbvie.name: Laura Schumacher
abbvie.bio: Served as Vice Chairman, External Affairs and Chief Legal Officer at AbbVie, one of the highest-ranking women in the pharmaceutical industry.

regeneron-pharmaceuticals.name: Leonard Schleifer
regeneron-pharmaceuticals.bio: Co-founded Regeneron Pharmaceuticals in 1988 and has led the company as CEO ever since, overseeing development of blockbuster drugs including Eylea and Dupixent.

regeneron-pharmaceuticals.name: George Yancopoulos
regeneron-pharmaceuticals.bio: Co-founded Regeneron and serves as President and Chief Scientific Officer. A physician-scientist who has driven the company's innovative drug discovery platform.

regeneron-pharmaceuticals.name: P. Roy Vagelos
regeneron-pharmaceuticals.bio: Served as Chairman of Regeneron's board and was an early supporter of the company. Previously led Merck as CEO, where he oversaw development of breakthrough drugs including lovastatin.

valeant-bausch-health.name: J. Michael Pearson
valeant-bausch-health.bio: Led Valeant Pharmaceuticals as CEO from 2008 to 2016, pursuing an aggressive acquisition and price-hiking strategy that ultimately led to the company's dramatic downfall.

valeant-bausch-health.name: Joseph Papa
valeant-bausch-health.bio: Succeeded Michael Pearson as CEO in 2016 and oversaw the rebranding from Valeant to Bausch Health Companies, working to stabilize the troubled pharmaceutical firm.

valeant-bausch-health.name: Bill Ackman
valeant-bausch-health.bio: Billionaire hedge fund manager (Pershing Square Capital) who made a massive investment in Valeant that became one of the most high-profile losses in hedge fund history.

valeant-bausch-health.name: Howard Schiller
valeant-bausch-health.bio: Served as CFO of Valeant Pharmaceuticals and briefly as interim CEO during the company's accounting scandal and leadership crisis in 2015-2016.
